info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 2:51PM MDT until June 27 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, Espanola Valley and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...From 6 PM MDT this evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Persistent moderate to potentially locally heavy rainfall will raise the risk of flash flooding over this area which has already seen one to two inches of rainfall in the past 24 to 36 hours. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
